name: Pasha Apart-Hotel

reviews.text: I have been to Pasha before and come back as it truely is a wonderful place to stay. It is not like your traditional hotel, it is intimate, friendly, relaxing, quiet and peaceful in the day and close and chatty in the lovely bar area. We met some wonderful guests that stayed during our trip and it felt like being part of a family or group of friends. You are left to be as quiet or chatty as you like, nothing is too much trouble and Imelda and Mark (owners) really know their stuff ! They recommend great restaurants and trips and can even book them for you. The pool area is like a secret garden and we decadently even had a beer in the pool! We also had tea and biscuits, not in the pool. The apartments are lovely and have kitchnets where you can keep olives, feta, crisps etc to enjoy on your balcony. They server good wine and fab coctails by Denis the cheeky barman. Denis also got our shopping for us and it was delivered to our apartment, saved the legs. We have already booked to go back next year and know we will have another amazing holiday. Thank you Pasha.

Why stay anywhere else in Kalkan?
reviews.text: Fabulous little hotel. Everyone raves about this place - for good reason. Its like staying in your own private villa but with super friendly owners and an awesome bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed with my boyfriend in July 2011. Im a bit obsessive about checking reviews on Tripadvisor and from what Id read Pasha was right up our street.
reviews.title: A real tonic

reviews.text: The location is great - just a short walk into Kalkan centre. Its not as central as other hotels in Kalkan but to be honest, I wouldnt want to be right next door to the bars and restaurants anyway.
reviews.title: OUR AMAZING WEDDING AT PASHA KALKAN

reviews.text: As an apart hotel, the rooms have their own kitchen, balcony and living area. Having a little kitchen is super handy for preparing snacks and drinks even though you will want to eat out every night in Kalkan! Everything is simply furnished but with homely ttouches. And its all spotlessly clean. THe only slight complaint was taht the beds arent the comfiest but thats not a major gripe.
reviews.title: Pasha apartments are brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, so anyone who reads the reviews about Pasha, and there are many, will quickly realise that the place has a bit of a fan club. It’s a simple formula - sincere, friendly and helpful which Mark and Imelda make it look so easy.
reviews.title: More Turkish Delight.......

reviews.text: With only 9 bedrooms Pasha has a nice home from home feel about the place. This is not a swanky boutique hotel with the obligatory spa. The place is clean, the rooms a good size, the pool area is a place to relax and unwind; book reading, sleeping and cooling off in the pool is the order of the day, no inflatable’s here. Any thing more energetic, then head off to one of the local beach clubs.
reviews.title: totally unexpected delight

reviews.text: The bar and outside lounge area becomes a meeting place for early doors drinks with guests and the odd passer by dropping in. After a couple of cocktails it’s off into the centre to sample one of the many first rate restaurants available. If you take Imelda’s advice she’ll recommend a restaurant and book you a table, thus eliminating the where to eat tonight decision.
reviews.title: Another wonderful holiday at Pasha

reviews.text: This was our first visit to Turkey and we were pleasantly surprised. The people are very friendly and the scenery is greener than I expected.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: There are a number of sights and excursions worth visiting, again Mark and Imelda can advise. We tried out Patara beach; Kas and lunch at Bodamya Tepe Restaurant (trout farm) up in the hills.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The whole Team are just brilliant > Mark & Imelda are wonderful hosts who make every guest feel special, like old friends. Nothing is a bother & they will go that extra mile to making sure your stay with them is just perfect...Deniz is a lovely guy who makes the best cocktails in Kalkan. Always smiling, always on hand at the start / end of your night with a friendly chat & a cheeky wee Mojito to send you on your way for a night in the town or off to bed with a warm happy glow.....Gulden kept our room spotless, so nice to return every day to crisp white clean sheets & the beautiful flowers you left was a lovely touch....
reviews.title: Already booked to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to Kalkan many times and it still remains a lovely location. Pasha is ideally located by Kalkan standards as it is a manageable walk to the harbour and main town. Many other places are much further up the hills. Mark and Imelda make you very welcome. Denis is a also welcome face at the bar. The room cleaning is carried out everyday and is spotless. The accommodation met our requirements and the pool is a nice size. We would recommend and would be happy to return.
reviews.title: Lovely
Wonderful, relaxing holiday
reviews.text: Pasha is a lovely place to stay, we stayed in one of the smaller apartments which had a lovely balcony overlooking the pool. The rooms are well equipped and are cleaned daily to a very high standard. The owners, Mark & Imelda are on hand every day to answer any questions you may have and are more than happy to recommend restaurants and book you a table if required. All of the restaurants we visited were excellent. The pool area is lovely and there are plenty of very comfortable sunbeds. This was our first visit to Kalkan and we would highly recommend Pasha for a relaxing, stress free holiday.
As soon as we arrived, we received a very warm welcome from Mark & Imelda. They were always on hand to offer advice and suggestions over where and what to eat in Kalkan.
reviews.title: Wonderful room, wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is part way up quite a steep hill however this was good exercise to burn off all the food eaten during the day!
reviews.title: Pasha Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the top apartment, which had an amazing view over the whole town, harbour and sea. The rooms were spotless with everything you needed, bit of a small kitchen however we wanted to eat the delicious food cooked by the locals anyway, not any attempts that we might have made in the evenings!
reviews.title: Comfortable and friendly place to stay

description: Small and Intimate, our family run bijou apart-hotel is a stoll away from the pretty village of Kalkan. Stylishly redesigned, furnished and decorated in 2006. A charming and friendly enviornment where you will feel immediately at home. 8 fully equiped apartments, pool, gardens and turkish style bar.
